# allSatisfy(_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Swift ](/documentation/swift)

- [ Int32 ](/documentation/swift/int32)

-  allSatisfy(_:) 

Instance Method# allSatisfy(_:)

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether every element of a sequence satisfies a given predicate.iOS 8.0+iPadOS 8.0+Mac Catalyst 13.0+macOS 10.10+tvOS 9.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+

```
func allSatisfy(_ predicate: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Bool
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/swift/int32/words-swift.struct/allsatisfy(_:)#parameters)

`predicate`A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the passed element satisfies a condition.

## [Return Value](/documentation/swift/int32/words-swift.struct/allsatisfy(_:)#return-value)

`true` if the sequence contains only elements that satisfy `predicate`; otherwise, `false`.

## [Discussion](/documentation/swift/int32/words-swift.struct/allsatisfy(_:)#discussion)

The following code uses this method to test whether all the names in an array have at least five characters:



```
let names = ["Sofia", "Camilla", "Martina", "Mateo", "NicolÃ¡s"]
let allHaveAtLeastFive = names.allSatisfy({ ___CODEBLOCK_0___.count >= 5 })
// allHaveAtLeastFive == true

```

If the sequence is empty, this method returns `true`.

Complexity

O(*n*), where *n* is the length of the sequence.
